jcr:content.jcr:title: Administrative divisions of Serbia and Montenegro

contentheadline.headline: Administrative divisions of Serbia and Montenegro

contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=June 2009|bot=yes}} {{Politics of Serbia_and_Montenegro}} '''[[Serbia and Montenegro]]''' consisted of two republics, the [[Republic of Serbia (federal)|Republic of Serbia]] and the [[Republic of Montenegro (federal)|Republic of Montenegro]]. ==Serbia== {{main|Subdivisions of Serbia}} [[Serbia]] had two autonomous provinces: * [[Vojvodina]] with its capital in [[Novi Sad]] and * [[Kosovo]] with its capital in [[Priština]] (under [[UN]] 1999-2006) The part of Serbia that was in neither (often called "[[Central Serbia]]") was not a province and had no special status. It had no capital nor a governing body. Independently of this division, Serbia was further divided into 29 [[district]]s (''[[okrug]]'') and the city of [[Belgrade]]. Each of districts (and the city) was further divided into [[municipality|municipalities]] (''opština''). ==Montenegro== {{main|Municipalities of Montenegro}} [[Montenegro]] was divided into 21 municipalities. ==See also== *[[Municipalities of Serbia]] *[[List of cities in Serbia and Montenegro]] *[[ISO 3166-2:CS]] <gallery> Image:Scg01.png|Republics of Serbia and Montenegro Image:Scg02.png|Autonomous provinces of Serbia and Montenegro </gallery> [[Category:Serbia and Montenegro]] [[Category:Subdivisions of former countries|Serbia and Montenegro]]
